public class Anisotropy_
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

Calculate degree of anisotropy using the mean intercept length method

Author:
Michael Doube
See Also:

Odgaard A (1997) Three-dimensional methods for quantification of cancellous bone architecture. Bone 20: 315-28. doi:10.1016/S8756-3282(97)00007-0

countIntercepts

public double[] countIntercepts(double[] centroid,
                                double[][] vectorList,
                                int nVectors,
                                double radius,
                                double vectorSampling)

Counts the number of intercepts between each vector in a set of vectors and a binary 3D image.

Vector length and intercept count should be summed over all vectors with same direction and sum of length divided by sum of count to give mean intercept length for each vector.

Parameters:
centroid - 3-element array containing calibrated 3D centroid location
vectorList - array containing unit vectors
nVectors - number of vectors in each set
radius - length of vectors
vectorSampling - distance between tests along each vector
Returns:
1D array containing a count of intercepts for each vector

PrincipalComponents

public Jama.EigenvalueDecomposition PrincipalComponents(double[][] coOrdinates)
Calculate the eigenvectors and eigenvalues of a set of points by the covariance method and eigendecomposition.

Parameters:
coOrdinates - n x 3 array centred on (0,0,0)
Returns:
EigenvalueDecomposition containing eigenvectors and eigenvalues

fitEllipsoid

public double[][] fitEllipsoid(double[][] coOrdinates)
Calculate the best-fit ellipsoid by least squares

Parameters:
coOrdinates - n x 3 array containing 3D coordinates
Returns:
10 x 1 array containing constants for the ellipsoid equation ax2 + by2 + cz2 + 2fyz + 2gxz + 2hxy + 2px + 2qy + 2rz + d = 0
See Also:

Qingde Li, Griffiths J (2004) Least squares ellipsoid specific fitting. Geometric Modeling and Processing, 2004. Proceedings. pp. 335-340. doi:10.1109/GMAP.2004.1290055

Plot a set of 3D coordinates in Benjamin Schmidt's ImageJ 3D Viewer

Parameters:

name - String name of the dataset
